title: Electric field of a charged metal triangle

content.question: The diagram shows the electric field near a charged metallic triangular plate. The dashed lines are paths of equal length along which an integral may be evaluated. Integrating the electric field along a certain path can provide information about the changes in electric potential along the path. Which of the following equations correctly relates integrals along the paths <math alttext="A B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>AB</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>BC</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>CD</mtext></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from A to B, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, plus the integral from B to C, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, minus the integral from C to D, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mo> </mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="the integral from A to B, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, plus the integral from B to C, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, minus the integral from C to D, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, is greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mo> </mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo mathvariant="italic">→</mo></mover><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="the integral from A to B, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, plus the integral from B to C, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, plus the integral from C to D, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo mathvariant="italic">→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="the integral from A to B, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, plus the integral from B to C, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, plus the integral from C to D, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, is less than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo mathvariant="italic">→</mo></mover><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="the integral from A to B, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, minus the integral from B to C, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, minus the integral from C to D, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mo> </mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>-</mo><mrow><mo> </mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msubsup></mrow><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo mathvariant="italic">→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from A to B, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, plus the integral from B to C, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, plus the integral from C to D, of, the dot product of vector E, d vector r, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>+</mo><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></msubsup><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>·</mo><mi>d</mi><mover><mi>r</mi><mo mathvariant="italic">→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
